item.title: Understanding Netflow v5
item.author: Luís Franco
item.description: NetFlow is a protocol developed by Cisco that has had several iterations over the years. This network protocol’s main focus is to collect IP traffic information and export it for monitoring purposes. A router configured to collect NetFlow will aggregate data packets into what is known as a flow, which is basically a summary of the traffic passing through the device in a given time span. Of the multiple iterations of the NetFlow protocol that Cisco has produced, two have cemented themselves as the most commonly used protocols: NetFlow v5 and NetFlow v9.
